result.execSummary:
The defendant Daven D Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay fine of $100.00 including all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 11/14/16, cash bail to apply. Court orders penalty for nonpayment of fines is conversion into a civil judgment.
*Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daven D Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered defendant to serve 1 day in the House of Correction, with 2 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court also ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $100.00 INCLUDING all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 11/14/16, cash bail to apply.  Court orders penalty for nonpayment of fines is conversion into a civil judgment.

Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.

Court ordered 12/16/15 jury trial date vacated.

Defendant Daven D Davis in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared final pretrial conference.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Daven D Davis in court with attorney Adam C Essling as a friend of the court for attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for motion hearing.
Motion hearing proceeded.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, defendant's motion to dismiss for defective complaint and defendant's motion to dismiss alleging vagueness of the statutory scheme related to carrying a concealed weapon are DENIED by the court. Defense counsel requests jury trial date.  Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
-State's Reply To Defendant's Motion To Dismiss from Assistant District Attorney Brittany Kachingwe; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-From State of Wisconsin Department of Justice; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
FILED, MOTION TO DISMISS ALLEGING VAGUENESS OF THE STATUTORY SCHEME RELATED TO CARRYING A CONCEALED WEAPON

Defendant Daven D Davis in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.    Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. For reasons stated on the record as to co-defendant scheduled for motion hearing. Defense counsel requests motion hearing also on behalf of his client.  Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by July 6, 2015. State's response: August 14, 2015.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 37.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-01-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Daven D Davis
Current: 6601 West Sheridan Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 04-27-2015)
Prior: 6601 West Sheridan Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Daven D Davis in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/27/15 @ 1:30 pm
